info.name: double AA with fwidth
info.description:
left:   bottom:   no AA
         top:         only the strip borders are AA with fwidth. Problem when strip themselves get too thin.
right:                too thin strips are AA too with another fwidth.

try variant patterns for 'a'

renderpass.code:
#define SQR(v)     ( (v)*(v) )
  #define fwidth2(v)  sqrt( SQR(dFdx(v)) + SQR(dFdy(v)) ) // for more isotropic
//#define fwidth2(v)  fwidth(v)

void mainImage(out vec4 O, vec2 u ) {    
    vec2  R = iResolution.xy,
          U = ( u+u - R ) / R.y;
          
    float a = round(R.y/2.) * atan(U.y,U.x) + 3.*iTime,   // strip parameterization
       // a = round(R.y/6.) * ( sin(4.*atan(U.y,U.x)) - length(U) ) , // variant pattern
          s = sin( a ),                                   // strip base
          v = U.y > 0.
                ? clamp(.5 + .5 * s/fwidth(s), 0.,1.)     // top: strip pattern with AA borders
                : step( 0., s ),                          // bottom: no AA
      aa = smoothstep(3.14/3., 6.28/3., fwidth2(a));      // detect param going too fast
          
     if (U.x > 0.) v = mix(  v, .5, aa );                 // right: switch to grey to AA high strip freq
    
    O = vec4( sqrt( v ) );                                // to sRGB

    if ( int(u.x)==int(R.x)/2 ) O = vec4(1,0,0,1);        // vertical separator
    if ( int(u.y)==int(R.y)/2 ) O = vec4(1,0,0,1);        // horizontal separator
}
renderpass.name: Image
